remarks: The restriction of a function to an unbounded-above interval is eventually upper bounded iff the original is eventually upper bounded. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-May-2016.)
statement:
lo1resb.1 $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> RR ) $.
lo1resb.2 $e |- ( ph -> A C_ RR ) $.
lo1resb.3 $e |- ( ph -> B e. RR ) $.
lo1resb $p |- ( ph -> ( F e. <_O(1) <-> ( F |` ( B [,) +oo ) ) e. <_O(1) ) ) $.
